glsa.title: GPL Ghostscript: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: An integer overflow in GPL Ghostscript may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Ghostscript is an interpreter for the PostScript language and for PDF.

description.p: An integer overflow flaw was discovered that leads to an out-of-bounds read and write in gs_ttf.ps.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GPL Ghostscript users should upgrade to the latest version:
